Text.Value: Forgive me... mistress. I would of course be honoured to pass my research onto you.
Pretty. I'll take it.
Ah, you must be the one Xargrim battled.
Why would I tell you?
Xargrim's dead. His body's rotting in a myconid circle.
Dust. On. My. Tongue!
Hmm. Perhaps you are telling the truth. Perhaps not.
Gods. Gods. I might have to raise your corpse just so I can kill you twice.

EditorData.stateContext: Dhourn no longer holding memory shard

Text.Value: Not to sound ungrateful, but you couldn't have saved some of my guards? I'm left to carry my own luggage.
Far, far longer than I realised.
I'm above house politics myself - but I'll still kill for what I want.
We'll be moving, just as soon as my guards are done moaning.
Well now. It seems his rather unique mind made itself useful. Clever of you to see through his cypher.
You think it clever to steal from a statue, do you?

EditorData.NodeContext: To us, with suspicion and fury

Text.Value: Perhaps we can claim the forge together, split the proceeds.
I've already been made a living statue for this damn crystal. A little pain will not deter me.
... I... rather infuriatingly, I seem to have lost it. Should you locate it, the knowledge within can be unlocked with the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.
Now - you are?
HAND IT OVER, BOY. OR ELSE.
Filro went mad. I had to kill him.
By any chance... did you find anything of interest on dear Xargrim's corpse?
You don't understand. A memory shard ought to hold its glow for years - and look at it! It's fading.
Enterprising of you - the others knew of the forge's defences, its operation... but I am the only one who knows its location.
I simply cannot suffer another rival in this. So killing you is a compliment, if you think about it.
Liar. How?
The rest I can figure out with time, now I am the only one searching. Or... almost the only one.
In fact - you've served your purpose now, so allow me to demonstrate.
I bid you luck at the forge. All that labour - not fitting for Dhourn, first son of House Ba'Tol.
But should you find it, mistress - the pass-phrase is 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'. A rather... aspirational title, I know - but no longer needed.
But I'm afraid I can't. You've proven a little too resourceful, and I really can't suffer another rival for this prize.
... you were so very close. If only you had just a little less cheek, I might have let you live.
Well. This knowledge is only useful so long as I am the only one who holds it. My apologies.
So try to take this as a compliment, yes?
They knew of the forge's defences, its operation, true enough. But I know its location.
Wait. I'll take that crystal of yours as thanks.

EditorData.stateContext: Dhourn holding memory shard in his open hand in front of him for the player to see

Text.Value: I mean to say, mistress - I have undertaken this research myself, beholden to no house or hold.

EditorData.NodeContext: Continuing more diplomatically, through gritted teeth

Text.Value: Hah, just as my fortunes turn for the better. Rather lucky for me - less so for you, mistress.
Every house is beholden to Lolth - as every male is beholden to their betters.
You first.
... do you know how many years we spent searching? Studying? For you to simply stumble on it?
A memory shard. They hold their glow for years - and it's fading.
And you fell for it. You clearly don't have the intellect to pose a threat... but you did manage to kill a spectator.
What forge?
Impossible. The master of the Adamantine Forge would be known - and feared - throughout the Underdark.
Just a book. He had some particular literary tastes.
... oh. Oh no no my dear dark GODS BELOW, NO!

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Holding up a crystal in mute horror, its light shining dim

Text.Value: Leave.
Unless... hah. Hah! The fools must have turned back. Or better yet, died in the search. Good.
What knowledge does the crystal contain, exactly?
Do you speak of the Adamantine Forge? It's still hidden, as far as I know.
It contains knowledge that is precious to me. If it has grown this dull...
I was exploring across the lake.
Pah. A rival - a mere footnote to my legend. You should be more concerned with who I am.
I'll put them to better use. And, on the off chance you've read them yourself...
Why indeed. I think I'll find you easier to speak to once you're a corpse.
I'm afraid I didn't.
Filro's gone mad. He joined a pack of hook horrors.
'Battled'? Please - that implies rivalry. He will but a footnote in my legend.
... then my brothers have perished in my absence? With no sons to replace them...
You'll claim nothing. Hand over the crystal - I'll take it from here.
... just an... aspiration for a wizard of my talents, mistress.
I have plenty of time, now I'm the only one hunting for the forge. Or... almost the only one.
Consider it mercy - or pest control. Filro was never fully right.
Then my enemies have already found the forge. Which bastard stole my glory - Xargrim? Filro?

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Places memory shard back in his back pocket

Text.Value: Impossible. My rivals would have stopped at nothing.
Neither bastard rings a bell, I'm afraid.
Some text - but it's written in code.
You release me and hand-deliver such a prize? I ought to keep you.
I offer to parley, and he brings a spectator? Twit. Quite ruined my ambush.
But no - they hoarded their knowledge, left each of us clinging to scraps.
I believe I'll have to kill you and ask again.
I must have misheard you. Perhaps you'll speak louder from a rack in Menzoberranzan.
I'm more concerned with this 'twit' who set a spectator on you.
Nothing.
The Adamantine Forge? If it had been found, the name would ring throughout the Underdark.
Truly? Perhaps they've improved his manner.
Take the shard then, please- only... I seem to have lost it.
I decoded his notes - he'd written about some guardian of the Adamantine Forge.
Bold of you to ask. The others knew of the forge's defences, its operation... but I know where to find it.
So the bastard was hiding something. Trust Xargrim to require instructions.
This memory shard holds the location of the lost Adamantine Forge. It answers to the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.
We were friends once, three of us working together to find a lost wonder. Until the others grew jealous, began to guard their secrets.
All right. I'll let you get back to whatever this is.
Xargrim had no taste at all. But enough low cunning to use an illusion? Absolutely.
Did he have anything...  interesting in his possession?
What's that?
*A memory shard. A container onto which brief mental impressions are projected, and stored for years at a time.*
You proved your power in freeing me - but I need no more rivals. Try to take this as a compliment, yes?
You're asking if I robbed your friend?
It's fading - it seems you've been frozen like that for a while.
It sounds like you were each as bad as the other.
Do you speak of the Adamantine Forge? It's still hidden, as far as I know.
Truly? Excellent - he might actually serve some purpose feeding fungus.
I am Dhourn. Third son of House Ba'Tol, first rank evoker, and initiate of Gravenhollow's...

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)
EditorData.NodeContext: Trailing off at end as he reaches into pocket (off-screen)

Text.Value: ... my apologies, mistress. I am still coming back to my senses.
We simply haven't time for all of my titles.
Nothing.
If you didn't, you're a fool. The dead have no use for what's in their pockets.
The memory shard answers to the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.
House Ba'Tol, you said? You'll be welcomed back - all the male heirs died, I believe.
He had this manual on him.
I'm afraid I didn't.
Disappointing. But he's out of the way, so small blessings I suppose.
... my crystal. My memory shard. Where is it?

EditorData.NodeContext: Rising panic as he can't find an item we stole from him.

Text.Value: The Adamantine Forge? That was me, actually.
Not your concern. Hand over your research - I'll take over from here.
Away. I must gather my strength and free my companions here. I'm not going to carry my own luggage.
Accustomed to a little more respect from a male.
I haven't the slightest idea what you're talking about.
If they had just surrendered their research to me, we might have found the forge together.
Just an... aspiration, mistress. But if my house now has room to honour me as I deserve, I have no need to chase relics any longer.
Does it? Then I'll be sure to give my telling a little polish for the history books.
A little too clever. I'd rather not lose one rival only to have another sprout in his place.
Take the shard, then - it holds the location of the lost Adamantine Forge. It answers to the pass-phrase 'Dhourn, Lord Archmage'.
Rescue. Helpless babes are rescued. I allowed you to assist me.
I had the good sense to lock mine away in the memory shard. And now I can claim the forge alone.
You bloody well -

EditorData.NodeContext: Furious at the suggestion, remembers he's talking to his betters

Text.Value: Xargrim's dead. His body's rotting in a myconid circle.
Well. I have some business I am long overdue in completing, and I'm sure you have... something to do.
Respectfully - you have already taken my life's work. What else could you possibly need?
'Alone'? Don't you still need your rivals' research?
I'm [GEN_PlayerName_c11eee1e-7815-6143-7233-f2427799fa53]. You're welcome for the rescue.

Synopsis:
Drow Wizard that has some info about the Adamantine Furnace.
Paranoid after being petrified by the spectator.
narrative feature: Used to kill his oponents and interrogate them afterwards (Disguise Self + Speak With Dead).
